explanation:
code_hardening: Implemented lazy initialization with a null-check return to ensure the cached panel is reused. Guarded against null text field, list, and scrollbar references before wiring accessibility and focus properties.
resolve_compilation_errors: Used existing fields (fontStylePanel) and constants (TOP_PANE_PREFERRED_HEIGHT) already defined in the class, and relied on fully available Swing/AWT types consistent with the file imports.
exception_handling: none
logic_customization: Moved font-style panel construction into getFontStylePanel(), switched to BorderLayout, applied an empty border and fixed preferred size, added a top "Font Style" label with mnemonic 'Y' and labelFor binding, and composed a subpanel with the style text field above a scrollable style list. Configured the scroll pane to always show the vertical scrollbar and made it non-focusable.
refactoring: Centralized panel creation responsibility in this accessor and cached the result to avoid repeated construction; replaced inline layout behavior with a clear BorderLayout-based composition and named sizing via constants.
misc: Added minimal comments and accessibility properties consistent with surrounding methods; no new custom API calls were introduced (none).
